title: 09. The Battle of Salamis
description: Key events and interpretations of the naval battle at Salamis.

questions.question: Who does Herodotus present as cowardly and stupid?
Who convinced the Greeks that Salamis was the best place to engage the Persian fleet?
What was his argument?
options: The terrain suited the Greeks better, in open sea the Persians could use their numbers
The Persians could be outflanked by the Greeks
The Persians would be exhausted by a long battle
The Persian navy was poorly organized

questions.question: How were the Persians supposedly lured into attacking the Greeks?
options: Themistocles offered peace in exchange for battle
Themistocles sent a slave to tell the Persians the Greeks were about to flee
The Greeks sent false signals to the Persian fleet

questions.question: Who does Herodotus tell us fled the battle before it began, and was only convinced to return by a divine vision?
Why should we be suspicious of this story of cowardice?
options: The Athenians say this, but the other Greeks disagree
Other Greeks confirm the cowardice of Adeimantus
There is no evidence of any cowardice
The Athenians were the only ones who fled

questions.question: Roughly how many Persian ships were lost or captured?
Where did a Greek ground force annihilate part of the Persian army at the same time?
Who did Xerxes leave behind in Greece when he returned to Asia after the defeat?
Where did the Greeks cease following Xerxes?
What places did the Greeks punish for medising?
Where did the remaining Persian army go to spend the winter?
Who was given the Greek prize for valour after the battle?
